meanings.definition: A ceremonial feast among certain Native American peoples of the northwest coast, at which possessions are given away or destroyed to display wealth or enhance prestige.
meanings.sent1: During the potlatching, the tribe shared food and gifts to celebrate.
meanings.sent2: The potlatching was a grand event where generosity and status were on full display.
meanings.sent3: At the potlatching, everyone eagerly awaited the distribution of gifts.
meanings.sent4: The potlatching was like a colorful tapestry woven with acts of giving and sharing.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the potlatching lingered in the minds of all who attended.

meanings.sent1: She decided to potlatch her family heirlooms to honor her ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The chief potlatched his treasures to show his generosity and power.
meanings.sent3: Potlatching her belongings brought a sense of fulfillment and tradition.
meanings.sent4: Potlatching can be a way to strengthen bonds within a community.
meanings.sent5: He potlatched his possessions with a joyful heart and open hands.
